item.title: Mang Tani: Online classes should be suspended due to storm signals
item.description: With the country transitioning into a blended learning system amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, GMA s resident meteorologist Nathaniel “Mang Tani” Cruz said on Saturday that even online classes should be suspended when storm warning signals were raised.

item.title: Watchlisted ex-cop, henchman killed while allegedly resisting arrest
item.description: A former police officer who was on President Rodrigo Duterte s drug watchlist and his alleged accomplice were killed in Minglanilla, Cebu after they supposedly resisted arrest.

item.title: Duque: 20,000 individuals need to be contact traced in Bulacan
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III on Saturday said that 20,000 individuals should be contact traced in Bulacan based on the number of active coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases in the province.

item.title: Chinese national allegedly shot, set fire to by countrymen in Pampanga
item.description: A Chinese national was shot to death and his corpse set fire to by fellow Chinese nationals in Angeles City, Pampanga on Saturday, according to Pia Arcangel s report on “24 Oras Weekend.”

item.title: Russia produces first batch of COVID-19 vaccine -news agency
item.description: MOSCOW - Russia has produced the first batch of its new vaccine for COVID-19, the Interfax news agency quoted the health ministry as saying on Saturday, hours after the ministry reported the start of manufacturing.

item.title: COVID-19 recoveries in PNP exceed 2,000 with 178 new ones
item.description: The number of personnel who have recovered from the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) within the Philippine National Police (PNP) surpassed 2,000 on Saturday after the agency reported 178 new ones, bringing the total to 2,019.

item.title: DILG urges firms to set up isolation facilities for employees
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government (DILG) appealed to companies to set up isolation facilities for its employees amid the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.

item.title: BRP Jose Rizal arrives in Hawaii for RIMPAC 2020 naval exercise
item.description: The Philippine Navy s (PN) brand new frigate, the BRP Jose Rizal (FF150), with a naval helicopter embarked, arrived at the Joint Base Pearl Harbor-HICKAM in Hawaii on Saturday where it will participate in the upcoming Rim of the Pacific Exercise 2020 (RIMPAC 2020).

item.title: Imee suggests PhilHealth execs signed waivers for trick bank accounts
item.description: Senator Imee Marcos suggested on Saturday that the bank accounts Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) officials had submitted for investigation by the Anti-Money Laundering Council (AMLC) were possibly not their real accounts.

item.title: Imee Marcos calls for preventive suspension of PhilHealth execs
item.description: Senator Imee Marcos on Saturday said officials of the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) should be put under preventive suspension as the agency was investigated for corruption.

item.title: Sta. Monica-Lawton Bridge project nears completion --Secretary Villar
item.description: Public Works Secretary Mark Villar on Saturday said the Sta. Monica-Lawton Bridge, a major component of the BGC-Ortigas Road Link Project, is nearing its completion stage.

item.title: Palace on 75th year of WW2's end: Reaffirm faith in basic human rights
item.description: Malacañang on Saturday enjoined the public and the international community in commemorating the 75th anniversary of the end of World War 2.

item.title: Private schools may start classes ahead of Oct. 5 opening -DepEd
item.description: Private schools may start their classes before the October 5 school opening as long as only distance learning modalities will be implemented and that there are no face-to-face classes, the Department of Education (DepEd) said Saturday.

item.title: Involvement of politics in Susukan surrender try troubles Lacson
item.description: The possible involvement of politics in the case of the Abu Sayyaf leader Anduljihad Susukan, who was arrested while in the Davao City home of Moro National Liberation Front founding chairman Nur Misuari, could undermine the country's anti-terrorism efforts, Senator Panfilo Lacson warned in a Saturday statement.

item.title: CALAx Laguna segment interchanges to open next week -Secretary Villar
item.description: The Laguna Boulevard, and Laguna Technopark interchanges of the Cavite-Laguna Expressway (CALAx) are set to open for motorists in the coming week.
